title: I've noticed the Only Ones saying ADC's aren't Too strong are Plat or Lower ADC mains
body:
With a mixture of supports thrown in. Considering this is 30-40% of the playerbase, it's not surprise Riot has brought ADC as a role so extremely far into the Broken zone, but this also highlights a major problem with gameplay balance boards when it comes to League of Legends.

The only board I've ever been to that values a higher elo players opinion more than someone who is silver or gold is Reddit's summoner school. On that site, they have flairs designated to the right side of your name stating your elo, which helps filter some of the lower elo bullshit from the actual reality that is League of Legends. They also try to avoid throwing rants around in place of actual gameplay discussion. For example, if some silver 4 player starts ranting about how Yi has no counter play, the post would be deleted for not following the sub reddits rules. If, however, a silver 4 player asked "how do I beat yi," or a Diamond League player made a post saying, "how to beat yi at lower elos," it would stay up.

This is why "circle jerks" (I hate that term, because it's only used on a post you disagree with) get so massively upvoted saying blatantly untrue things. On these boards, a Silver players upvote and Thread has the same visibility and power as someone who is Challenger. There is no way to discern who's who without copying and pasting their name into a third party source, which most people don't have the time for.

And for everyone's inevitable, "Bronze opinions matter to!" I will tell you first hand, I understood so much less about this game when I was gold and below. There's a threshold in this game, right around high plat that changes it drastically. All the sudden the meta game starts to effect you. There are no more Yasuo, Darius, or Yi bans. It's all going to revolve around who the strongest objectively is, and those that you play against are playing what is good and nothing else, unless they are some one trick. Your gameplay knowledge increases and you begin to look at the game from a more logical point, and everyone who hasn't BEEN up here will never understand it.

This is not rude. Being rude would be calling them losers for being low elo players, or the like. Saying that they are disgusting human beings or something.

Simply stating, "Lower elo opinions are typically wrong," isn't messed up, it's an observation. I'm adamant about people being silver or gold or whatever and beating themselves up about it is wrong, that it's just a video game. 

Even if you're silver you're just an average player, and have put tons of time into learning something that you'd be better than anyone that just starts. That in itself is a slight accomplishment. 

However, that does not mean they should get the same say when it comes to gameplay balance, or we get things like the assassin rework and the absurd strength of supports and ADC's.

I'm conflicted. On the one hand I know that we don't always get it right and ask for the wrong changes because we don't understand things on the level that higher level players do... On the other hand though, I think that the game should be made to be fun for players of all skill levels.

With the way the game works and how some champions are, some of them are just plain broken and unfun to deal with below a certain skill level. Maybe Riot should implement a tier list system that changes as the meta shifts. Something to prevent or mitigate certain champions getting played at certain levels if they stomp that level for a patch or longer. Bans already sort of do this though so I'm not sure what else could be done.

I've got no idea about how to make the game balanced at all skill levels, but Riot should look into it more.

No you couldn't because ADCs are the least reliant on levels. 

Top laners need the base stats (tankiness) and damage from abilities. 

mid laners need the base damage from abilities.

Support wouldn't scale at all with a jungler.

ADCs, meanwhile, need gold first and foremost. Having a gold lead is way more important than a level lead for the most part.

Plenty of top laners get lots better with item spikes. I can think of a few that become monstrously better once they complete their triforce. And juggernauts can make use of certain types of supporting, such as cc and movespeed buffs.

I don't think it would be impractical.

Because of the lower stats they'd have and the ease of bullying them, the supports that would be meta are Zyra and Brand in that case. 

It wouldn't work out. Ever.

Unless you are just a better player and can punish them with a playmaker, there's no real way of beating that.

Top lane is a lot more diverse than people give credit for. You see bruisers, duelists, carries, and tanks within the top 10 pickrates. 

Jungle currently has very low gold income, and lower XP gain. It's very hard to outscale a tank jungler, since tank-support itemization is inherently very strong in a low budget environment.

Since tanks right now are much more focused on CC/engage/peel, as opposed to earlier this season when tanks could just fight anyone, assassins are punished much harder. It's even harder to outplay a Janna or Raka as an assassin too. That said, Talon, Fizz, and Kat seem to be doing just fine in Solo Q, with Kat and Talon nearing 54% winrates each. They're relatively more versatile in design, which makes them more adaptable. 

As for ADCs, people don't seem to understand how itemization buffs work. The fact that they are building crit instead of lethality is what's important. The fact that Energize has been changed and now people can stack RFC and Shiv is important. However, IE being a little bit better isn't really that big of a deal - IE has always been built when crit is built. So I really just have to smh when people propose nerfs like IE only critting for 205%. Yes, powercreep is a thing but items are only but one component of balance, and IE is still weaker than it was in S2 as an item.
